"Be Pitiful, Be Courteous." He who is successful in His work for God must be courteous. Courtesy gains access to hearts. The worker for Christ must be to principle as firm as a rock, but at the same time he is to reveal the Saviour's gentleness. He is to be kind as well as true. He is to observe the weightier matters of the law, and he is also to observe the little proprieties of life. Christ desires our lives to be fragrant and refreshing, a blessing to 


                                   -147- 

others. The Christian is to be true and honest, and yet kind and forbearing, pitiful and courteous.
